page.title: 10GENERAL ENVIRONMENT
page.content: {..General Environment.. There has been residential building around these villages,restricted to a high priced market.The village houses & period cottages are sought after,a serious handicap to the continuation of family life,the young people have to move out to buy their own homes. There are a few Council houses at Wol- verton & several rented houses,people come to live for limited times.Some farm-owners are running their large farms from afar so that decisions such as hedge removing are made for economic reasons not for the good of the area as a whole.Boundary Oaks have been planted by a local man.Many hedges went through Dutch Elm Disease & were not re-planted.The general atmosphere is one of well-being the houses are beautifully kept,the fields are continually planted & productive.
